title: [Champion Concept] Deriyum, the Enthralled Construct
body:
Appearance
A lean stone golem that is covered in biomass. The golem itself had flattened ends on its limbs, measured several meters tall, had an exposed magical core in its chest, and was mostly featureless but exceptionally smooth otherwise. The biomass now covering it hides the magical core, almost entirely encapsulates its head, randomly covers the rest of its body, and it’s right arm is merely the base of a much larger and longer organic arm.

Overview

Primary: Tank
Secondary: Support

Attack Form: Melee

Top / Support

CC Mage / Group Supporter

Toughness
2/3

Damage
1/3

Mobility
1/3

Utility
3/3

Control
2/3

Health: 710 (+48)
Health Regen: 3.1 (+ 0.73)
Mana: 345 (+31)
Mana Regen: 11 (+0.575)
Range: 225
Attack Damage: 62 (+2.7)
Attack Speed: 0.485 (+3.3%)
Armor: 34 (+3.3)
Magic Resist: 32.1 (+ 1.25)
Movement Speed: 325

Weapons/Pets:
Biomass (Has a hidden intelligence Deriyum can understand)
Creatures 

Gender: Undefined

Birthplace: Unknown

Residence: Unknown (Nomadic)


Spells


Passive: Brood Skin

Deriyum passively collects biomass from enemies it slays. It is able to spend this like a currency to upgrade his Creatures in the shop. Upgrades include basic Health/Damage/MR/Armor upgrades, some life steal upgrades, and the ability to grant them an ability similar to his E.


 Q - Rapid Consumption

Passive: Killing an enemy unit increases Deriyum’s attack range by 5, up to a max of 330. (This is reflected by his living arm growing in length.) For every 40 extra range, 
Deriyum will be able to attack another target with his basic attacks. All stacks are lost upon death. 

Active: Deriyum consumes all stacks of Rapid Consumption to heal for 120/145/160/180/190 (+1% Max health) (+1% per 25 stacks Missing health) over 2 seconds and fearing all enemies within 400 units for 2/2.25/2.5/2.75/3 seconds.


 W - Invading Biomass/Benign Biomass

Invading Biomass Toggle: Enemies damaged by Deriyum will take 2% of their missing health over 6 seconds, refreshed once if they are damaged by Deriyum again. After the refresh, targets become immune to Invading Biomass for 14 seconds. If a target dies under this effect, they will become covered in Biomass and resurrected as a Creature, having 20% of their health, armor, magic resist, physical damage, ability power and dealing mixed damage. They also apply Invading Biomass themselves if it is active, but their version only deals 25% of the damage it normally does. These creatures keep their method of attack from when they were alive, and will follow Deriyum until killed. Max of 2 minion/small monster creatures, 1 large monster creature, and 1 champion creature.

Benign Biomass Toggle: Enemies killed by Deriyum or a Creature gives them a stack of Benign Biomass. At 10 stacks, or upon death, Benign Biomass shields the nearest allied champion within 500 units for 105/130/155/175/190 (+10% Ability Power) (+4% Current Health) (-10% strength for every missing stack if triggered by death). This shield cannot stack and will rapidly decay once the ally enters combat. If no suitable allies can be found, the shield will then try to target Deriyum, then any Creatures.


 E - Grapple

Deriyum grabs a hold of a target enemy within (his range plus 300, minimum of 525 units and maximum of 630 units) units, damaging all enemy units his arm passes through by 40/65/80/95/115 (+5% Attack Damage) physical damage, with the target enemy being rooted for 4 seconds. Deriyum can then throw the target enemy 300 units in a chosen direction, stopping if they collide with another unit or terrain. Upon collision, the target enemy (and the enemy they collide with if they do collide with one) takes 40/65/80/95/115 (+15% Attack Damage) (+5% for every 100 units traveled) physical damage and are stunned for 2 seconds.


 R - Full Control

Passive: For every Void related item bought or champion present on Deriyum’s team, Deriyum will appear more covered in biomass. This doesn’t affect the game at all.

Active: Deriyum surrenders to the Void for 8/13/19 seconds, growing in size by 30% and massively empowering Invading Biomass and Grapple. All Creatures are affected by this as well.


Quotes

Upon Selecting
(Loud growling sounds)...I hunger...

First Move
(Low growl)
(Short grunt)
...my heart grows weaker...
...this filth consumes me...
....the veil is weakened here... (pleased growl)

Movement
(Short grunt 2)
...Makers guide me...
...they will make good followers...
...they will feed the Void...
(Loud screech)
(Long Growl)
...I wish to rest... (Annoyed grunt)
...I wonder what would happen if I truly helped them...
...damned (intelligible)...
(Low growl 2)

Attacking
(Pleased growl 2)
(Pleased growl 3)
...run...
...they hunger for you...
...you would make a fine meal for them...
...they will turn you...
...I don’t want this...
(gasp)
(Ravenous scream)

Killing An Enemy Champion
(Pleased growl 4)
(Pleased screech)
...I’m sorry this happened to you...
...Death is no end to you...

Killing An Enemy Voidborn
...What are you...
...Strange creature...
(Confused grunt)
(Confused screech)

Joke
(The Biomass reshapes itself into a giant heart)

...It only wishes to grow on you...
...You look like you need someone to talk to...
(Beckoning chittering)
(Beckoning chittering 2)

Taunt
(The Biomass reforms around Deriyum to look somewhat like the nearest visible enemy champion)

...It makes a better version of you than you...
...You will be replaced, but no one will notice..,
...No one will miss you...
(Mocking scream)

Taunt Response
...Is that all you can muster...
...surely you could’ve thought of something clever...
(Loud, warped, gargling laughing)

Taunting An Enemy Ryze
...that scroll looks interesting...

Taunting An Enemy Nocturne
...the shadows cannot swallow what swallows them...

Taunting An Enemy Mordekaiser
...your body and soul would make a fine host for the Biomass... (Pleased scream)
...don’t let it absorb you... (enraged scream)
(Pleased growl 5)

Taunting An Enemy Aatrox
...you’ve changed since I was free of this abomination...
...you’ve allowed yourself to fall pretty hard...

Upon Recalling
...we must make do with more stuff...
...replenish our strength for now...
(Sad growl)

Upon Dying
(Extremely painful screeching)
(Extremely painful screeching 2)
(Loud, warped, gargling laughing)
...thank you...
...the abomination fades...

Upon Respawning
...back again...
...why can I feel again...
...it’s never for long, is it...
(Annoyed grunt 2)
